general_city_data.description: Madrid, the capital of Spain, is a vibrant metropolis renowned for its rich history, stunning architecture, and lively culture. It's a city where the old and new seamlessly blend, from the historic Royal Palace and Plaza Mayor to modern art museums and bustling nightlife. Madrid offers a diverse culinary scene, world-class shopping, and numerous parks and gardens providing respite from the urban energy. Its central location makes it an excellent base for exploring other regions of Spain. The city is known for its passionate locals, its love of football, and its vibrant arts and culture scene.
general_city_data.timezone: Central European Time (CET) / Central European Summer Time (CEST)
general_city_data.weather: Madrid has a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and cool, wet winters. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures.
general_city_data.attractions: Royal Palace of Madrid, Prado Museum, Reina Sofia Museum, Retiro Park, Plaza Mayor, Temple of Debod, Gran Vía, Puerta del Sol, Santiago Bernabéu Stadium, El Rastro Flea Market.
general_city_data.history: Madrid's history dates back to the 9th century when it was a Moorish fortress. It became the capital of Spain in 1561 under King Philip II. The city has played a significant role in Spanish history, witnessing numerous political and social changes. It has evolved from a small town to a major European capital, preserving its historical charm while embracing modernity.

points_of_interest.name: Prado Museum
points_of_interest.description_poi: One of the world's greatest art museums, housing masterpieces by Spanish masters like Goya, Velázquez, and El Greco, as well as works by European artists.

points_of_interest.name: Reina Sofía Museum
points_of_interest.description_poi: Madrid's national museum of 20th-century art, best known for housing Picasso's 'Guernica'.

points_of_interest.name: Royal Palace of Madrid
points_of_interest.description_poi: The official residence of the Spanish Royal Family, though it is only used for state ceremonies. Explore the opulent rooms and admire the royal collections.

points_of_interest.name: Retiro Park
points_of_interest.description_poi: A large and beautiful park in the heart of Madrid, perfect for a stroll, boat ride, or picnic. Features include the Crystal Palace, the Rose Garden, and the boating lake.

points_of_interest.name: Plaza Mayor
points_of_interest.description_poi: A grand and historic square in the heart of Madrid, surrounded by beautiful buildings and bustling with activity. A great place to people-watch and soak up the atmosphere.

points_of_interest.name: Puerta del Sol
points_of_interest.description_poi: A central square in Madrid, known as the 'Kilometer Zero' point for all of Spain's roads. Home to the famous clock that Spaniards watch on New Year's Eve.

points_of_interest.name: Temple of Debod
points_of_interest.description_poi: An ancient Egyptian temple that was donated to Spain. Offers stunning sunset views over the city.

opening_hours.general: Oct-Mar: Tue-Sun 9:30-20:00, Apr-Sep: Tue-Sun 9:30-22:00, Mon Closed

points_of_interest.name: Gran Vía
points_of_interest.description_poi: Madrid's most famous street, known for its impressive architecture, theaters, shops, and restaurants.

points_of_interest.name: Santiago Bernabéu Stadium
points_of_interest.description_poi: Home stadium of Real Madrid, one of the most successful football clubs in the world. Take a tour to explore the stadium and learn about its history.
points_of_interest.address: Av. de Concha Espina, 1, Chamartín, 28036 Madrid

opening_hours.general: Varies depending on events and tours. Check website for details.

points_of_interest.name: El Rastro Flea Market
points_of_interest.description_poi: A large and bustling flea market held every Sunday in the La Latina neighborhood. A great place to find unique souvenirs, antiques, and vintage items.

itinerary_response.itinerary_name: Madrid Tapas & Treasures: A Flexible Exploration
itinerary_response.overall_description: This itinerary offers a flexible exploration of Madrid, catering to a traveler with no specific budget, pace, or vibe preferences. It focuses on experiencing the heart of the city through its culinary scene and iconic landmarks. The itinerary is designed to be adaptable, allowing you to choose your mode of transportation and adjust the timings based on your personal preferences. From indulging in traditional tapas to exploring historical sites, this plan provides a foundation for discovering the vibrant culture of Madrid at your own pace. Since no dietary restrictions are specified, the food recommendations are based on traditional Spanish cuisine. Remember to check opening hours and availability, especially during peak season.

points_of_interest.name: Plaza Mayor
points_of_interest.description_poi: A grand and historic square in the heart of Madrid, surrounded by beautiful buildings and bustling with activity. Perfect for soaking in the atmosphere and people-watching.

points_of_interest.name: Mercado de San Miguel
points_of_interest.description_poi: A vibrant and historic food market offering a wide variety of Spanish tapas, wines, and other culinary delights. A great place to sample local flavors and enjoy a lively atmosphere.
points_of_interest.address: Plaza de San Miguel, s/n, 28005 Madrid, Spain

points_of_interest.name: Sobrino de Botín
points_of_interest.description_poi: The oldest restaurant in the world (according to the Guinness World Records), serving traditional Castilian cuisine, especially roast suckling pig. A historic and memorable dining experience.

points_of_interest.name: Royal Palace of Madrid
points_of_interest.description_poi: The official residence of the Spanish Royal Family, although it is only used for state ceremonies. Explore the opulent rooms and admire the impressive architecture.
points_of_interest.address: Plaza de la Armería, s/n, 28071 Madrid, Spain

opening_hours.general: Check website for daily hours, typically 10:00-18:00 or 10:00-20:00 depending on the season.

points_of_interest.name: Temple of Debod
points_of_interest.description_poi: An ancient Egyptian temple donated to Spain by Egypt. A unique and peaceful place to enjoy panoramic views of the city, especially at sunset.

opening_hours.general: Check website for daily hours, typically 10:00-14:00 and 18:00-20:00.
